dlpPaymentPercentage) of the payment"},"version()":{"notice":"Returns the version of the contract"}},"version":1}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"contracts/queryEngine/QueryEngineImplementation.sol":"QueryEngineImplementation"},"evmVersion":"paris","libraries":{},"metadata":{"bytecodeHash":"ipfs","useLiteralContent":true},"optimizer":{"enabled":true,"runs":1},"remappings":[]},"sources":{"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/access/AccessControlUpgradeable.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\n// OpenZeppelin Contracts (last updated v5.0.0) (access/AccessControl.sol)\n\npragma solidity ^0.8.20;\n\nimport {IAccessControl} from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/access/IAccessControl.sol\";\nimport {ContextUpgradeable} from \"../utils/ContextUpgradeable.sol\";\nimport {ERC165Upgradeable} from \"../utils/introspection/ERC165Upgradeable.sol\";\nimport {Initializable} from \"../proxy/utils/Initializable.sol\";\n\n/**\n * @dev Contract module that allows children to implement role-based access\n * control mechanisms. This is a lightweight version that doesn't allow enumerating role\n * members except through off-chain means by accessing the contract event logs. Some\n * applications may benefit from on-chain enumerability, for those cases see\n * {AccessControlEnumerable}.\n *\n * Roles are referred to by their `bytes32` identifier. These should be exposed\n * in the external API and be unique. The best way to achieve this is by\n * using `public constant` hash digests:\n *\n * ```solidity\n * bytes32 public constant MY_ROLE = keccak256(\"MY_ROLE\");\n * ```\n *\n * Roles can be used to represent a set of permissions. To restrict access to a\n * function call, use {hasRole}:\n *\n * ```solidity\n * function foo() public {\n *     require(hasRole(MY_ROLE, msg.sender));\n *     ...\n * }\n * ```\n *\n * Roles can be granted and revoked dynamically via the {grantRole} and\n * {revokeRole} functions. Each role has an associated admin role, and only\n * accounts that have a role's admin role can call {grantRole} and {revokeRole}.\n *\n * By default, the admin role for all roles is `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE`, which means\n * that only accounts with this role will be able to grant or revoke other\n * roles. More complex role relationships can be created by using\n * {_setRoleAdmin}.\n *\n * WARNING: The `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` is also its own admin: it has permission to\n * grant and revoke this role. Extra precautions should be taken to secure\n * accounts that have been granted it. We recommend using {AccessControlDefaultAdminRules}\n * to enforce additional security measures for this role.\n */\nabstract contract AccessControlUpgradeable is Initializable, ContextUpgradeable, IAccessControl, ERC165Upgradeable {\n    struct RoleData {\n        mapping(address account => bool) hasRole;\n        bytes32 adminRole;\n    }\n\n    bytes32 public constant DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE = 0x00;\n\n\n    /// @custom:storage-location erc7201:openzeppelin.storage.AccessControl\n    struct AccessControlStorage {\n        mapping(bytes32 role => RoleData) _roles;\n    }\n\n    // keccak256(abi.encode(uint256(keccak256(\"openzeppelin.storage.AccessControl\")) - 1)) & ~bytes32(uint256(0xff))\n    bytes32 private constant AccessControlStorageLocation = 0x02dd7bc7dec4dceedda775e58dd541e08a116c6c53815c0bd028192f7b626800;\n\n    function _getAccessControlStorage() private pure returns (AccessControlStorage storage $) {\n        assembly {\n            $.slot := AccessControlStorageLocation\n        }\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Modifier that checks that an account has a specific role. Reverts\n     * with an {AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount} error including the required role.\n     */\n    modifier onlyRole(bytes32 role) {\n        _checkRole(role);\n        _;\n    }\n\n    function __AccessControl_init() internal onlyInitializing {\n    }\n\n    function __AccessControl_init_unchained() internal onlyInitializing {\n    }\n    /**\n     * @dev See {IERC165-supportsInterface}.\n     */\n    function supportsInterface(bytes4 interfaceId) public view virtual override returns (bool) {\n        return interfaceId == type(IAccessControl).interfaceId || super.supportsInterface(interfaceId);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`.\n     */\n    function hasRole(bytes32 role, address account) public view virtual returns (bool) {\n        AccessControlStorage storage $ = _getAccessControlStorage();\n        return $._roles[role].hasRole[account];\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Reverts with an {AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount} error if `_msgSender()`\n     * is missing `role`. Overriding this function changes the behavior of the {onlyRole} modifier.\n     */\n    function _checkRole(bytes32 role) internal view virtual {\n        _checkRole(role, _msgSender());\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Reverts with an {AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount} error if `account`\n     * is missing `role`.\n     */\n    function _checkRole(bytes32 role, address account) internal view virtual {\n        if (!hasRole(role, account)) {\n            revert AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount(account, role);\n        }\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and\n     * {revokeRole}.\n     *\n     * To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.\n     */\n    function getRoleAdmin(bytes32 role) public view virtual returns (bytes32) {\n        AccessControlStorage storage $ = _getAccessControlStorage();\n        return $._roles[role].adminRole;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Grants `role` to `account`.\n     *\n     * If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted}\n     * event.\n     *\n     * Requirements:\n     *\n     * - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.\n     *\n     * May emit a {RoleGranted} event.\n     */\n    function grantRole(bytes32 role, address account) public virtual onlyRole(getRoleAdmin(role)) {\n        _grantRole(role, account);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Revokes `role` from `account`.\n     *\n     * If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event.\n     *\n     * Requirements:\n     *\n     * - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.\n     *\n     * May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.\n     */\n    function revokeRole(bytes32 role, address account) public virtual onlyRole(getRoleAdmin(role)) {\n        _revokeRole(role, account);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Revokes `role` from the calling account.\n     *\n     * Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's\n     * purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges\n     * if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced).\n     *\n     * If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked}\n     * event.\n     *\n     * Requirements:\n     *\n     * - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`.\n     *\n     * May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.\n     */\n    function renounceRole(bytes32 role, address callerConfirmation) public virtual {\n        if (callerConfirmation != _msgSender()) {\n            revert AccessControlBadConfirmation();\n        }\n\n        _revokeRole(role, callerConfirmation);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Sets `adminRole` as ``role``'s admin role.\n     *\n     * Emits a {RoleAdminChanged} event.\n     */\n    function _setRoleAdmin(bytes32 role, bytes32 adminRole) internal virtual {\n        AccessControlStorage storage $ = _getAccessControlStorage();\n        bytes32 previousAdminRole = getRoleAdmin(role);\n        $._roles[role].adminRole = adminRole;\n        emit RoleAdminChanged(role, previousAdminRole, adminRole);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Attempts to grant `role` to `account` and returns a boolean indicating if `role` was granted.\n     *\n     * Internal function without access restriction.\n     *\n     * May emit a {RoleGranted} event.\n     */\n    function _grantRole(bytes32 role, address SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity 0.8.24;\n\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/structs/EnumerableSet.sol\";\nimport \"../../computeEngineTeePool/interfaces/IComputeEngineTeePool.sol\";\nimport \"../../dataAccessPayment/interfaces/IPaymentExecutor.sol\";\nimport \"../../dataAccessTreasury/interfaces/IDataAccessTreasury.sol\";\nimport \"../../computeInstructionRegistry/interfaces/IComputeInstructionRegistry.sol\";\nimport \"../../computeEngineTeePoolFactory/interfaces/IComputeEngineTeePoolFactory.sol\";\n\ninterface IComputeEngine is IPaymentExecutor {\n    enum JobStatus {\n        None,\n        Registered, // The job is registered to the ComputeEngine contract\n        Submitted, // The job is submitted to the appropriate TeePool contract and assigned to a Tee\n        Running, // The job is running on the assigned Tee (the status is updated by the Tee)\n        Completed,\n        Failed,\n        Canceled\n    }\n\n    struct Job {\n        address ownerAddress;\n        uint80 maxTimeout;\n        bool gpuRequired;\n        JobStatus status;\n        address teeAddress;\n        uint32 computeInstructionId;\n        uint48 addedTimestamp;\n        string statusMessage;\n        address teePoolAddress;\n    }\n\n    struct PaymentInfo {\n        address payer;\n        mapping(address token => uint256 amount) paidAmounts;\n    }\n\n    /// @notice Returns the version of the contract\n    /// @return The version of the contract\n    function version() external pure returns (uint256);\n\n    /// @notice Pauses the contract\n    function pause() external;\n\n    /// @notice Unpauses the contract\n    function unpause() external;\n\n    /// @notice Returns the query engine\n    /// @return The query engine\n    function queryEngine() external view returns (address);\n\n    /// @notice Updates the query engine\n    /// @param queryEngineAddress The new query engine\n    function updateQueryEngine(address queryEngineAddress) external;\n\n    /// @notice Returns the compute engine treasury\n    /// @return The compute engine treasury\n    function computeEngineTreasury() external view returns (IDataAccessTreasury);\n\n    /// @notice Updates the compute engine treasury\n    /// @param computeEngineTreasuryAddress The new compute engine treasury\n    function updateComputeEngineTreasury(IDataAccessTreasury computeEngineTreasuryAddress) external;\n\n    function instructionRegistry() external view returns (IComputeInstructionRegistry);\n\n    function updateInstructionRegistry(IComputeInstructionRegistry instructionRegistryAddress) external;\n\n    function teePoolFactory() external view returns (IComputeEngineTeePoolFactory);\n\n    function updateTeePoolFactory(IComputeEngineTeePoolFactory teePoolFactoryAddress) external;\n\n    ////////////////////////\n    ///// Job Registry /////\n    ////////////////////////\n\n    /// @notice Returns the number of jobs\n    function jobsCount() external view returns (uint256);\n\n    /// @notice Returns the job with the given ID\n    /// @param jobId The ID of the job\n    function jobs(uint256 jobId) external view returns (Job memory);\n\n    /// @notice Submits a job to the ComputeEngine\n    function submitJob(uint80 maxTimeout, bool gpuRequired, uint256 computeInstructionId) external payable;\n\n    /// @notice Resubmits a job\n    function resubmitJob(uint256 jobId) external;\n\n    /// @notice Submits a job to the ComputeEngine and assigns it to a dedicated Tee\n    /// @param maxTimeout The maximum timeout for the job\n    /// @param gpuRequired True if the job requires GPU, false otherwise\n    /// @param computeInstructionId The ID of the compute instruction\n    /// @param teeAddress The address of the Tee to assign the job to\n    function submitJobWithTee(\n        uint80 maxTimeout,\n        bool gpuRequired,\n        uint256 computeInstructionId,\n        address teeAddress\n    ) external payable;\n\n    /// @notice Resubmits a job with a dedicated Tee\n    function resubmitJobWithTee(uint256 jobId, address teeAddress) external;\n\n    /// @notice Cancels a job\n    /// @param jobId The ID of the job to cancel\n    function cancelJob(uint256 jobId) external;\n\n    /// @notice Updates the status of a job\n    /// @param jobId The ID of the job\n    /// @param status The new status of the job\n    /// @param statusMessage The status message\n    /// @dev Only the Tee assigned to the job can update the status\n    function updateJobStatus(uint256 jobId, JobStatus status, string calldata statusMessage) external;\n\n    //////////////////////////\n    ///// Wallet Balance /////\n    //////////////////////////\n    function deposit(address token, uint256 amount) external payable;\n\n    function withdraw(address token, uint256 amount) external;\n\n    function balanceOf(address account, address token) external view returns (uint256);\n\n    function paymentInfo(uint256 jobId, uint256 dlpId, address token) external view returns (uint256 amount);\n\n    function vanaPaymentInfo(uint256 jobId, uint256 dlpId) external view returns (uint256 amount);\n}\n","keccak256":"0x5ae989476dbc16f9b0ff7762e423a48ab9741dbf39f5e06114bfe63a360bfb47","license":"MIT"},"contracts/computeEngineTeePool/ComputeEngineTeePoolProxyFactory.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity 0.8.24;\n\nimport \"hardhat/console.sol\";\n\nimport {BeaconProxy} from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/proxy/beacon/BeaconProxy.sol\";\nimport {UpgradeableBeacon} from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/proxy/beacon/UpgradeableBeacon.sol\";\n\ncontract ComputeEngineTeePoolProxyFactory is UpgradeableBeacon {\n    constructor(address initImplementation, address initOwner) UpgradeableBeacon(initImplementation, initOwner) {}\n\n    function createBeaconProxy(bytes memory data) external returns (address) {\n        bytes32 SALT = keccak256(abi.encodePacked(msg.sender));\n        BeaconProxy proxy = new BeaconProxy{salt: SALT}(address(this), data);\n        return address(proxy);\n    }\n\n    function getProxyAddress(bytes memory data, address deployer) public view returns (address) {\n        bytes memory initCode = abi.encodePacked(type(BeaconProxy).creationCode, abi.encode(address(this), data));\n        bytes32 bytecodeHash = keccak256(initCode);\n        bytes32 SALT = keccak256(abi.encodePacked(deployer));\n        bytes32 hash = keccak256(abi.encodePacked(bytes1(0xff), address(this), SALT, bytecodeHash));\n        return address(uint160(uint256(hash)));\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x5445c7403128ba51d5cf182718b0280097e87d42a31a2cca83bd455ed55016c8","license":"MIT"},"contracts/computeEngineTeePool/interfaces/IComputeEngineTeePool.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity 0.8.24;\n\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/structs/EnumerableSet.sol\";\nimport \"./ITeePool.sol\";\n\ninterface IComputeEngineTeePool is ITeePool {\n    enum TeePoolType {\n        None,\n        Ephemeral,\n        Persistent,\n        Dedicated\n    }\n\n    enum HardwareType {\n        None,\n        Standard, // CPU only\n        GPU\n    }\n\n    enum TeeStatus {\n        None,\n        Active,\n        Removed\n    }\n\n    struct Tee {\n        string url;\n        TeeStatus status;\n        EnumerableSet.UintSet jobIdsList;\n        string publicKey;\n    }\n\n    struct TeeInfo {\n        address teeAddress;\n        string url;\n        TeeStatus status;\n        uint256 jobsCount;\n        string publicKey;\n    }\n\n    /// @notice Returns the type of the Tee pool\n    function teePoolType() external view returns (TeePoolType);\n\n    // /// @notice Updates the type of the Tee pool\n    // /// @param teePoolType The new type of the Tee pool\n    // /// @dev Only callable by the TeePoolFactory contract to ensure consistency\n    // function updateTeePoolType(TeePoolType teePoolType) external;\n\n    /// @notice Returns the hardware type of the Tee pool\n    function hardwareType() external view returns (HardwareType);\n\n    // /// @notice Updates the hardware type of the Tee pool\n    // /// @dev Only callable by the TeePoolFactory contract to ensure consistency\n    // function updateHardwareType(HardwareType hardwareType) external;\n\n    /// @notice Returns the maximum timeout for a job\n    function maxTimeout() external view returns (uint80);\n\n    /// @notice Updates the maximum timeout for a job\n    /// @param maxTimeout The new maximum timeout for a job\n    function updateMaxTimeout(uint80 maxTimeout) external;\n\n    /// @notice Returns the ComputeEngine contract address\n    function computeEngine() external view returns (address);\n\n    /// @notice Updates the ComputeEngine contract address\n    /// @param computeEngineAddress The new ComputeEngine contract address\n    function updateComputeEngine(address computeEngineAddress) external;\n\n    function teePoolFactory() external view returns (address);\n\n    function updateTeePoolFactory(address teePoolFactoryAddress) external;\n\n    /// @notice Returns the Tee info for the given address\n    /// @param teeAddress The address of the Tee\n    /// @return The Tee info\n    function tees(address teeAddress) external view returns (TeeInfo memory);\n\n    /// @notice Returns the Tee info for the Tee at the given index\n    /// @param index The index of the Tee\n    /// @return The Tee info\n    function teeListAt(uint256 index) external view returns (TeeInfo memory);\n\n    /// @notice Returns the Tee info for the active Tee at the given index\n    /// @param index The index of the active Tee\n    /// @return The Tee info\n    function activeTeeListAt(uint256 index) external view returns (TeeInfo memory);\n}\n","keccak256":"0xe74941804b8846f7ed4178f25ec03d6f764c73ac4c2856780553e1958653db4a","license":"MIT"},"contracts/computeEngineTeePool/interfaces/ITeePool.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity 0.8.24;\n\n/// @title A generic interface for a TeePool contract\n/// @notice A contract or interface that inherits this interface should\n/// define its own TeeInfo and Job structs.\ninterface ITeePool {\n    /// @notice Returns the version of the contract\n    /// @return The version of the contract\n    function version() external pure returns (uint256);\n\n    /// @notice Pauses the contract\n    function pause() external;\n\n    /// @notice Unpauses the contract\n    function unpause() external;\n    \n    /// @notice Returns the number of Tees\n    /// @return The number of Tees\n    function teesCount() external view returns (uint256);\n    \n    /// @notice Returns the list of Tee addresses\n    /// @return The list of Tee addresses\n    function teeList() external view returns (address[] memory);\n    \n    /// @notice Returns the number of active Tees\n    /// @return The number of active Tees\n    function activeTeesCount() external view returns (uint256);\n    \n    /// @notice Returns the list of active Tee addresses\n    /// @return The list of active Tee addresses\n    function activeTeeList() external view returns (address[] memory);\n    \n    /// @notice Checks if the given address is a Tee\n    /// @param teeAddress The address to check\n    /// @return True if the address is a Tee, false otherwise\n    function isTee(address teeAddress) external view returns (bool);\n\n    /// @notice Adds a Tee to the pool\n    /// @param teeAddress The address of the Tee\n    /// @param params The parameters for the Tee\n    function addTee(address teeAddress, bytes calldata params) external;\n    \n    /// @notice Removes a Tee from the pool\n    /// @param teeAddress The address of the Tee\n    function removeTee(address teeAddress) external;\n\n    /// @notice Submits a job to the pool\n    /// @param params The parameters for the job\n    /// @return The address of the Tee assigned to the job\n    function submitJob(bytes calldata params) external returns (address, bytes memory);\n\n    /// @notice Removes a job in the pool\n    /// @param jobId The ID of the job to remove\n    function removeJob(uint256 jobId) external;\n}","keccak256":"0x5b99d68f3bdc7ed0342f173f08bc2d7e774f636f8780ec9dd2b4edb4bb825647","license":"MIT"},"contracts/computeEngineTeePoolFactory/interfaces/IComputeEngineTeePoolFactory.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity 0.8.24;\n\nimport {IDLPRegistry} from \"../../interfaces/IDLPRegistry.sol\";\n\ninterface IComputeInstructionRegistry {\n    struct ComputeInstruction {\n        bytes32 hash;\n        address owner;\n        string url;\n        mapping(uint256 dlpId => bool approved) dlpApprovals;\n    }\n\n    struct ComputeInstructionInfo {\n        bytes32 hash;\n        address owner;\n        string url;\n    }\n\n    /// @notice Pauses the contract\n    function pause() external;\n\n    /// @notice Unpauses the contract\n    function unpause() external;\n\n    /// @notice Returns the version of the contract\n    function version() external pure returns (uint256);\n\n    /// @notice Returns the DLPRegistry contract address.\n    function dlpRegistry() external view returns (IDLPRegistry);\n\n    /// @notice Updates the DLPRegistry contract address.\n    /// @param dlpRegistryAddress The address of the new DLPRegistry contract\n    function updateDlpRegistry(address dlpRegistryAddress) external;\n\n    /// @notice Returns the number of compute instructions in the contract\n    /// @return The number of compute instructions\n    function instructionsCount() external view returns (uint256);\n\n    /// @notice Returns the compute instruction for a given instruction ID\n    /// @param instructionId The ID of the compute instruction\n    /// @return The compute instruction info\n    function instructions(uint256 instructionId) external view returns (ComputeInstructionInfo memory);\n\n    /// @notice Returns the compute instruction's approval with the given ID\n    /// @param instructionId The ID of the compute instruction\n    /// @param refinerId The ID of the refiner\n    /// @return Whether the compute instruction has been approved against the refiner\n    function isApproved(uint256 instructionId, uint256 refinerId) external view returns (bool);\n\n    /// @notice Checks if the instruction ID is valid\n    /// @param instructionId The ID of the compute instruction\n    /// @return Whether the instruction ID is valid\n    function isValidInstructionId(uint256 instructionId) external view returns (bool);\n\n    /// @notice Adds a compute instruction to the registry\n    /// @param hash The hash of the compute instruction\n    /// @param url The URL of the compute instruction\n    /// @return The ID of the compute instruction\n    function addComputeInstruction(bytes32 hash, string calldata url) external returns (uint256);\n\n    /// @notice Updates the compute instruction's approval with the given ID\n    /// @param instructionId The ID of the compute instruction\n    /// @param dlpId The ID of the DLP\n    /// @param approved Whether the compute instruction has been approved against the refiner\n    function updateComputeInstruction(uint256 instructionId, uint256 dlpId, bool approved) external;\n}\n","keccak256":"0x726f57fbcfab02b12fb0f300907f194708f801ad96d7fecdaeb0bd9c8632384e","license":"MIT"},"contracts/dataAccessPayment/interfaces/IPaymentExecutor.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity 0.8.24;\n\ninterface IPaymentExecutor {\n    function executePaymentRequest(address token, uint256 amount, bytes calldata metadata) external;\n}\n","keccak256":"0x13f1c6fe5ee6d95be03af2bd50da68c8d3532f856c5dd7d1fdb8669117787224","license":"MIT"},"contracts/dataAccessPayment/interfaces/IPaymentRequestor.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity 0.8.24;\n\ninterface IPaymentRequestor {\n    function requestPayment(address token, uint256 amount, bytes memory metadata) external;\n}\n","keccak256":"0xa2598fcfa630f16b38b238dd5048f48e53d47b323634929e6a3e25f63b97958a","license":"MIT"},"contracts/dataAccessTreasury/DataAccessTreasuryImplementation.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity 0.8.24;\n\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/access/AccessControlUpgradeable.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/utils/PausableUpgradeable.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/utils/ReentrancyGuardUpgradeable.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/utils/SafeERC20.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/Address.sol\";\nimport \"./interfaces/DataAccessTreasuryStorageV1.sol\";\n\ncontract DataAccessTreasuryImplementation is\n    PausableUpgradeable,\n    AccessControlUpgradeable,\n    ReentrancyGuardUpgradeable,\n    DataAccessTreasuryStorageV1\n{\n    using SafeERC20 for IERC20;\n    using Address for address payable;\n\n    bytes32 public constant CUSTODIAN_ROLE = keccak256(\"CUSTODIAN_ROLE\");\n\n    address public constant VANA = address(0);\n\n    event Transfer(address indexed to, address indexed token, uint256 amount);\n    \n    error ZeroAmount();\n    error ZeroAddress();\n\n    /// @custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow constructor\n    constructor() {\n        _disableInitializers();\n    }\n\n    receive() external payable {}\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Initializes the contract\n     *\n     * @param ownerAddress Address of the owner\n     */\n    function initialize(address ownerAddress, address initCustodian) external initializer {\n        __Pausable_init();\n        __AccessControl_init();\n        __ReentrancyGuard_init();\n\n        custodian = initCustodian;\n\n        _setRoleAdmin(CUSTODIAN_ROLE, DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE);\n        _grantRole(DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE, ownerAddress);\n        _grantRole(CUSTODIAN_ROLE, ownerAddress);\n        _grantRole(CUSTODIAN_ROLE, initCustodian);\n    }\n\n    /// @inheritdoc IDataAccessTreasury\n    function version() external pure virtual override returns (uint256) {\n        return 1;\n    }\n\n    /// @inheritdoc IDataAccessTreasury\n    function pause() external override onlyRole(DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE) {\n        _pause();\n    }\n\n    /// @inheritdoc IDataAccessTreasury\n    function unpause() external override onlyRole(DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE) {\n        _unpause();\n    }\n\n    /// @inheritdoc IDataAccessTreasury\n    function updateCustodian(address newCustodian) external override onlyRole(DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE) {\n        _revokeRole(CUSTODIAN_ROLE, custodian);\n        custodian = newCustodian;\n        _grantRole(CUSTODIAN_ROLE, newCustodian);\n    }\n\n    /// @inheritdoc IDataAccessTreasury\n    function transfer(\n        address to,\n        address token,\n        uint256 amount\n    ) external override nonReentrant whenNotPaused onlyRole(CUSTODIAN_ROLE) {\n        if (amount == 0) {\n            revert ZeroAmount();\n        }\n        if (to == address(0)) {\n            revert ZeroAddress();\n        }\n\n        if (token == VANA) {\n            payable(to).sendValue(amount);\n        } else {\n            IERC20(token).safeTransfer(to, amount);\n        }\n\n        emit Transfer(to, token, amount);\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x7e438f6f69f8142af248381fd76ce53cd88e22ee9c70c3fabb3ed6ce21023ed8","license":"MIT"},"contracts/dataAccessTreasury/DataAccessTreasuryProxyFactory.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity 0.8.24;\n\nimport {BeaconProxy} from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/proxy/beacon/BeaconProxy.sol\";\nimport {UpgradeableBeacon} from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/proxy/beacon/UpgradeableBeacon.sol\";\n\ncontract DataAccessTreasuryProxyFactory is UpgradeableBeacon {\n    constructor(address initImplementation, address initOwner) UpgradeableBeacon(initImplementation, initOwner) {}\n\n    function createBeaconProxy(bytes memory data) external returns (address) {\n        bytes32 SALT = keccak256(abi.encodePacked(msg.sender));\n        BeaconProxy proxy = new BeaconProxy{salt: SALT}(address(this), data);\n        return address(proxy);\n    }\n\n    function getProxyAddress(bytes memory data, address deployer) public view returns (address) {\n        bytes memory initCode = abi.encodePacked(type(BeaconProxy).creationCode, abi.encode(address(this), data));\n        bytes32 bytecodeHash = keccak256(initCode);\n        bytes32 SALT = keccak256(abi.encodePacked(deployer));\n        bytes32 hash = keccak256(abi.encodePacked(bytes1(0xff), address(this), SALT, bytecodeHash));\n        return address(uint160(uint256(hash)));\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0xdd066e11d7f9cac31a6106abc68887a83291362b3bedd3c1e9ec00bc10ab43a6","license":"MIT"},"contracts/dataAccessTreasury/interfaces/DataAccessTreasuryStorageV1.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity 0.8.24;\n\nimport \"./IDataAccessTreasury.sol\";\n\n/**\n * @title Storage for DataAccessTreasury\n * @notice For future upgrades, do not change DataAccessTreasuryStorageV1.\n * Create a new contract which implements DataAccessTreasuryStorageV1\n */\nabstract contract DataAccessTreasuryStorageV1 is IDataAccessTreasury {\n    address public override custodian;\n}\n","keccak256":"0x80e55bea71cb9dae5e2b8f1423182762902651555b30184165c905a0eecb2aa2","license":"MIT"},"contracts/dataAccessTreasury/interfaces/IDataAccessTreasury.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity 0.8.24;\n\ninterface IDataAccessTreasury {\n    /// @notice Returns the version of the contract\n    /// @return The version of the contract\n    function version() external pure returns (uint256);\n\n    /// @notice Pauses the contract\n    function pause() external;\n\n    /// @notice Unpauses the contract\n    function unpause() external;\n\n    function custodian() external view returns (address);\n\n    function updateCustodian(address custodian) external;\n\n    /// @notice Transfers a token to the given address\n    /// @param to The address to transfer the token to\n    /// @param token The token to transfer\n    /// @param amount The amount of tokens to transfer\n    function transfer(address to, address token, uint256 amount) external;\n}\n\n","keccak256":"0xde969a83202c616a774ae9d99060af3bcd99a0f0738753c56e5f8e3cfbca1727","license":"MIT"},"contracts/dataRefinerRegistry/interfaces/IDataRefinerRegistry.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity 0.8.24;\n\nimport {IDLPRegistry} from \"../../interfaces/IDLPRegistry.sol\";\n\ninterface IDataRefinerRegistry {\n    struct Refiner {\n        uint256 dlpId;\n        address owner;\n        string name;\n        string schemaDefinitionUrl;\n        string refinementInstructionUrl;\n        string publicKey;\n    }\n\n    /// @notice Returns the version of the contract.\n    function version() external pure returns (uint256);\n\n    /// @notice Pauses the contract.\n    function pause() external;\n\n    /// @notice Unpauses the contract.\n    function unpause() external;\n\n    /// @notice Returns the DLPRegistry contract address.\n    function dlpRegistry() external view returns (IDLPRegistry);\n\n    /// @notice Updates the DLPRegistry contract address.\n    function updateDlpRegistry(address dlpRegistryAddress) external;\n\n    /// @notice Returns the number of refiners.\n    function refinersCount() external view returns (uint256);\n\n    /// @notice Returns the refiner with the given ID.\n    /// @param refinerId The ID of the refiner.\n    function refiners(uint256 refinerId) external view returns (Refiner memory);\n\n    /// @notice Returns the refiner IDs for a given DLP ID.\n    /// @param dlpId The ID of the DLP.\n    /// @return An array of refiner IDs.\n    function dlpRefiners(uint256 dlpId) external view returns (uint256[] memory);\n\n    /// @notice Adds a refiner to the registry.\n    /// @param dlpId The ID of the DLP.\n    /// @param name The name of the refiner.\n    /// @param schemaDefinitionUrl The URL of the schema definition.\n    /// @param refinementInstructionUrl The URL of the refinement Docker image.\n    /// @param publicKey The public key to encrypt the refined encryption key (REK).\n    /// @return The ID of the refiner.\n    function addRefiner(\n        uint256 dlpId,\n        string calldata name,\n        string calldata schemaDefinitionUrl,\n        string calldata refinementInstructionUrl,\n        string calldata publicKey\n    ) external returns (uint256);\n\n    /// @notice Updates the owner of a refiner.\n    /// @param refinerId The ID of the refiner.\n    function updateRefinerOwner(uint256 refinerId) external;\n\n    /// @notice Updates the owner of all refiners for a given DLP.\n    /// @param dlpId The ID of the DLP.\n    /// @dev This function is called when the DLP owner changes.\n    function updateDlpRefinersOwner(uint256 dlpId) external;\n}\n","keccak256":"0x6dd1eb6938ec2bc9b32772ff55fe17409665004c3c85091eb3a9aa5dde154f74","license":"MIT"},"contracts/interfaces/IDLPRegistry.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity 0.8.24;\n\ninterface IDLPRegistry {\n    enum DlpStatus {\n        None,\n        Registered,\n        Eligible,\n        Deregistered\n    }\n\n    struct DlpInfo {\n        uint256 id;\n        address dlpAddress;\n        address ownerAddress;\n        address tokenAddress;\n        address treasuryAddress;\n        string name;\n        string iconUrl;\n        string website;\n        string metadata;\n        uint256 registrationBlockNumber;\n        uint256 depositAmount;\n        DlpStatus status;\n        uint256 lpTokenId;\n        bool isVerified;\n    }\n\n    function dlps(uint256 dlpId) external view returns (DlpInfo memory);\n}\n","keccak256":"0xc720f37b60a9e4aa6efefcd074cbd2ef8f3487d4493aa47945e19086dbf83584","license":"MIT"},"contracts/queryEngine/QueryEngineImplementation.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity 0.8.24;\n\nimport {UUPSUpgradeable} from \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/proxy/utils/UUPSUpgradeable.sol\";\nimport {PausableUpgradeable} from \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/utils/PausableUpgradeable.sol\";\nimport {AccessControlUpgradeable} from \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/access/AccessControlUpgradeable.sol\";\nimport {ReentrancyGuardUpgradeable} from \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/utils/ReentrancyGuardUpgradeable.sol\";\nimport {IERC20} from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/IERC20.sol\";\nimport {Address} from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/Address.sol\";\nimport {SafeERC20} from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/utils/SafeERC20.sol\";\nimport {IDataRefinerRegistry} from \"../dataRefinerRegistry/interfaces/IDataRefinerRegistry.sol\";\nimport {IPaymentExecutor} from \"../dataAccessPayment/interfaces/IPaymentExecutor.sol\";\nimport \"../dataAccessTreasury/DataAccessTreasuryProxyFactory.sol\";\nimport \"../dataAccessTreasury/DataAccessTreasuryImplementation.sol\";\nimport \"./interfaces/QueryEngineStorageV1.sol\";\nimport \"../interfaces/IDLPRegistry.sol\";\n\ncontract QueryEngineImplementation is\n    UUPSUpgradeable,\n    PausableUpgradeable,\n    AccessControlUpgradeable,\n    ReentrancyGuardUpgradeable,\n    QueryEngineStorageV1\n{\n    using EnumerableSet for EnumerableSet.UintSet;\n    using Address for address payable;\n    using SafeERC20 for IERC20;\n\n    bytes32 public constant MAINTAINER_ROLE = keccak256(\"MAINTAINER_ROLE\");\n    bytes32 public constant QUERY_ENGINE_ROLE = keccak256(\"QUERY_ENGINE_ROLE\");\n\n    address public constant VANA = address(0);\n\n    uint256 public constant ONE_HUNDRED_PERCENT = 100e18;\n\n    event PermissionAdded(\n        uint256 indexed permissionId,\n        address indexed grantee,\n        uint256 indexed refinerId,\n        string tableName,\n        string columnName,\n        uint256 price\n    );\n\n    event PermissionApprovalUpdated(uint256 indexed permissionId, bool approved);\n    event PaymentReceived(address indexed token, uint256 amount, uint256 jobId, uint256 refinerId);\n    event DlpPaymentClaimed(\n        uint256 indexed dlpId,\n        address indexed dlpTreasuryAddress,\n        address indexed token,\n        uint256 amount\n    );\n    error NotRefinerOwner();\n    error PermissionNotFound();\n    error PaymentNotReceived();\n    error InvalidDlpPaymentPercentage();\n    error InvalidDlpTreasuryAddress();\n    error NotDlpOwner();\n    error DlpNotFound();\n    error ColumnNameUnexpected();\n    error RefinerNotFound();\n    error ZeroAddress();\n\n    /// @notice Reverts if the caller is not the owner of the refiner\n    /// @param refinerId The ID of the refiner\n    modifier onlyRefinerOwner(uint256 refinerId) {\n        if (refinerRegistry.refiners(refinerId).owner != msg.sender) {\n            revert NotRefinerOwner();\n        }\n        _;\n    }\n\n    receive() external payable {}\n\n    /// @custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow constructor\n    constructor() {\n        _disableInitializers();\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Initializes the contract\n     *\n     * @param ownerAddress Address of the owner\n     */\n    function initialize(\n        address ownerAddress,\n        address initRefinerRegistryAddress,\n        DataAccessTreasuryProxyFactory initDataAccessTreasuryFactory\n    ) external initializer {\n        __UUPSUpgradeable_init();\n        __Pausable_init();\n        __AccessControl_init();\n        __ReentrancyGuard_init();\n\n        refinerRegistry = IDataRefinerRegistry(initRefinerRegistryAddress);\n\n        /// @dev Deploy a new data access treasury for the query engine via beacon proxy\n        address impl = initDataAccessTreasuryFactory.implementation();\n        address proxy = initDataAccessTreasuryFactory.createBeaconProxy(\n            abi.encodeCall(DataAccessTreasuryImplementation(payable(impl)).initialize, (ownerAddress, address(this)))\n        );\n        queryEngineTreasury = IDataAccessTreasury(proxy);\n\n        _setRoleAdmin(MAINTAINER_ROLE, DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE);\n        _setRoleAdmin(QUERY_ENGINE_ROLE, DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE);\n        _grantRole(DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE, ownerAddress);\n        _grantRole(MAINTAINER_ROLE, ownerAddress);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Upgrades the contract\n     * This function is required by OpenZeppelin's UUPSUpgradeable\n     *\n     * @param newImplementation New implementation\n     */\n    function _authorizeUpgrade(address newImplementation) internal virtual override onlyRole(DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE) {}\n\n    function updateRefinerRegistry(address newRefinerRegistryAddress) external override onlyRole(MAINTAINER_ROLE) {\n        refinerRegistry = IDataRefinerRegistry(newRefinerRegistryAddress);\n    }\n\n    function updateComputeEngine(address newComputeEngineAddress) external override onlyRole(MAINTAINER_ROLE) {\n        computeEngine = IComputeEngine(newComputeEngineAddress);\n    }\n\n    function updateDlpPaymentPercentage(uint256 newDlpPaymentPercentage) external override onlyRole(MAINTAINER_ROLE) {\n        if (newDlpPaymentPercentage > ONE_HUNDRED_PERCENT) {\n            revert InvalidDlpPaymentPercentage();\n        }\n        dlpPaymentPercentage = newDlpPaymentPercentage;\n    }\n\n    function updateVanaTreasury(address newVanaTreasury) external override onlyRole(MAINTAINER_ROLE) {\n        if (newVanaTreasury == address(0)) {\n            revert ZeroAddress();\n        }\n        vanaTreasury = newVanaTreasury;\n    }\n\n    function updateQueryEngineTreasury(\n        IDataAccessTreasury newQueryEngineTreasury\n    ) external override onlyRole(MAINTAINER_ROLE) {\n        if (address(newQueryEngineTreasury) == address(0)) {\n            revert ZeroAddress();\n        }\n        queryEngineTreasury = newQueryEngineTreasury;\n    }\n\n    function updateDlpPubKey(uint256 dlpId, string calldata pubKey) external override onlyRole(MAINTAINER_ROLE) {\n        IDLPRegistry.DlpInfo memory dlp = refinerRegistry.dlpRegistry().dlps(dlpId);\n        if (dlp.dlpAddress == address(0)) {\n            revert DlpNotFound();\n        }\n        dlpPubKeys[dlpId] = pubKey;\n    }\n\n    /// @inheritdoc IQueryEngine\n    function version() external pure virtual override returns (uint256) {\n        return 1;\n    }\n\n    /// @inheritdoc IQueryEngine\n    function pause() external override onlyRole(MAINTAINER_ROLE) {\n        _pause();\n    }\n\n    /// @inheritdoc IQueryEngine\n    function unpause() external override onlyRole(MAINTAINER_ROLE) {\n        _unpause();\n    }\n\n    ///////////////////////\n    ///// Permissions /////\n    ///////////////////////\n\n    /// @inheritdoc IQueryEngine\n    function permissions(uint256 permissionId) external view override returns (Permission memory) {\n        return _permissions[permissionId];\n    }\n\n    /// @inheritdoc IQueryEngine\n    function addPermission(\n        address grantee,\n        uint256 refinerId,\n        string calldata tableName,\n        string calldata columnName,\n        uint256 price\n    ) external override returns (uint256 permissionId) {\n        return _addPermission(grantee, refinerId, tableName, columnName, price);\n    }\n\n    /// @inheritdoc IQueryEngine\n    function addGenericPermission(\n        uint256 refinerId,\n        string calldata tableName,\n        string calldata columnName,\n        uint256 price\n    ) external override returns (uint256 permissionId) {\n        return _addPermission(address(0), refinerId, tableName, columnName, price);\n    }\n\n    /// @notice Adds a permission to the contract\n    /// @param grantee The address of the grantee. If the address is 0, the permission is granted to everyone\n    /// @param refinerId The id of the refiner\n    /// @param tableName The name of the table\n    /// @param columnName The name of the column\n    /// @param price The price of data access under the permission\n    /// @return permissionId The id of the permission\n    function _addPermission(\n        address grantee,\n        uint256 refinerId,\n        string calldata tableName,\n        string calldata columnName,\n        uint256 price\n    ) internal onlyRefinerOwner(refinerId) whenNotPaused returns (uint256 permissionId) {\n        if (bytes(tableName).length == 0 && bytes(columnName).length > 0) {\n            revert ColumnNameUnexpected();\n        }\n\n        permissionId = ++permissionsCount;\n\n        Permission storage permission = _permissions[permissionId];\n        permission.grantee = grantee;\n        permission.refinerId = refinerId;\n        permission.tableName = tableName;\n        permission.columnName = columnName;\n        permission.approved = true;\n        permission.price = price;\n\n        _approvedPermissions[refinerId][grantee].add(permissionId);\n\n        emit PermissionAdded(permissionId, grantee, refinerId, tableName, columnName, price);\n    }\n\n    /// @inheritdoc IQueryEngine\n    function updatePermissionApproval(uint256 permissionId, bool approved) external override {\n        // Validate 1-indexed permissionId\n        if (permissionId == 0 || permissionId > permissionsCount) {\n            revert PermissionNotFound();\n        }\n\n        Permission storage permission = _permissions[permissionId];\n\n        // Check ownership\n        uint256 refinerId = permission.refinerId;\n        if (refinerRegistry.refiners(refinerId).owner != msg.sender) {\n            revert NotRefinerOwner();\n        }\n\n        // Early return if no state change needed\n        if (permission.approved == approved) {\n            return;\n        }\n        // Update storage\n        permission.approved = approved;\n\n        // Update approved permissions set\n        EnumerableSet.UintSet storage approvedSet = _approvedPermissions[refinerId][permission.grantee];\n        if (approved) {\n            approvedSet.add(permissionId);\n        } else {\n            approvedSet.remove(permissionId);\n        }\n\n        emit PermissionApprovalUpdated(permissionId, approved);\n    }\n\n    /// @inheritdoc IQueryEngine\n    function getPermissions(uint256 refinerId, address grantee) external view returns (PermissionInfo[] memory) {\n        // Get permission sets from storage\n        EnumerableSet.UintSet storage specificPermissionIds = _approvedPermissions[refinerId][grantee];\n        EnumerableSet.UintSet storage genericPermissionIds = _approvedPermissions[refinerId][address(0)];\n\n        // Calculate total length with overflow checks\n        uint256 genericLength = genericPermissionIds.length();\n        uint256 specificLength = (grantee != address(0)) ? specificPermissionIds.length() : 0;\n        uint256 totalLength = genericLength + specificLength;\n\n        // Create result array\n        PermissionInfo[] memory grantedPermissions = new PermissionInfo[](totalLength);\n\n        // Populate result array\n        uint256 index;\n\n        // Add generic permissions\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < genericLength; ) {\n            uint256 permissionId = genericPermissionIds.at(i);\n            Permission storage permission = _permissions[permissionId];\n            grantedPermissions[index] = PermissionInfo({\n                permissionId: permissionId,\n                grantee: permission.grantee,\n                approved: permission.approved,\n                refinerId: permission.refinerId,\n                tableName: permission.tableName,\n                columnName: permission.columnName,\n                price: permission.price\n            });\n            unchecked {\n                ++i;\n                ++index;\n            }\n        }\n\n        // Add specific permissions\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < specificLength; ) {\n            uint256 permissionId = specificPermissionIds.at(i);\n            Permission memory permission = _permissions[permissionId];\n            grantedPermissions[index] = PermissionInfo({\n                permissionId: permissionId,\n                grantee: permission.grantee,\n                approved: permission.approved,\n                refinerId: permission.refinerId,\n                tableName: permission.tableName,\n                columnName: permission.columnName,\n                price: permission.price\n            });\n            unchecked {\n                ++i;\n                ++index;\n            }\n        }\n\n        return grantedPermissions;\n    }\n\n    ///////////////////////\n    ///// Payments ////////\n    ///////////////////////\n\n    function requestPaymentInVana(\n        uint256 amount,\n        uint256 jobId,\n        uint256 refinerId\n    ) external nonReentrant onlyRole(QUERY_ENGINE_ROLE) {\n        bytes memory metadata = abi.encode(jobId, refinerId);\n        _requestPayment(VANA, amount, metadata);\n    }\n\n    function requestPayment(\n        address token,\n        uint256 amount,\n        bytes memory metadata\n    ) external nonReentrant onlyRole(QUERY_ENGINE_ROLE) {\n        _requestPayment(token, amount, metadata);\n    }\n\n    function _requestPayment(address token, uint256 amount, bytes memory metadata) internal {\n        (uint256 jobId, uint256 refinerId) = abi.decode(metadata, (uint256, uint256));\n\n        uint256 dlpId = refinerRegistry.refiners(refinerId).dlpId;\n        if (dlpId == 0) {\n            revert RefinerNotFound();\n        }\n\n        bool isVana = token == VANA;\n        // Store initial balance for verification\n        uint256 initialBalance = isVana ? address(this).balance : IERC20(token).balanceOf(address(this));\n\n        // Request payment from compute engine\n        IPaymentExecutor(computeEngine).executePaymentRequest(token, amount, abi.encode(jobId, dlpId));\n\n        // Verify payment was received\n        uint256 finalBalance = isVana ? address(this).balance : IERC20(token).balanceOf(address(this));\n        uint256 receivedAmount = finalBalance - initialBalance;\n\n        if (receivedAmount < amount) {\n            revert PaymentNotReceived();\n        }\n\n        emit PaymentReceived(token, receivedAmount, jobId, refinerId);\n\n        uint256 dlpPaymentAmount = (amount * dlpPaymentPercentage) / ONE_HUNDRED_PERCENT;\n        uint256 vanaPaymentAmount = receivedAmount - dlpPaymentAmount;\n\n        /// @dev Transfer the DLP payment portion to the treasury to be distributed to the DLP treasury\n        if (isVana) {\n            payable(address(queryEngineTreasury)).sendValue(dlpPaymentAmount);\n            payable(vanaTreasury).sendValue(vanaPaymentAmount);\n        } else {\n            IERC20(token).safeTransfer(address(queryEngineTreasury), dlpPaymentAmount);\n            IERC20(token).safeTransfer(vanaTreasury, vanaPaymentAmount);\n        }\n\n        /// @dev Store the payment for the DLP treasury to be claimed by the DLP later.\n        /// @dev This prevents errors when transferring funds to the DLP treasury disrupts the payment flow.\n        _dlpPayments[dlpId][token] += dlpPaymentAmount;\n    }\n\n    function claimDlpPayment(uint256 dlpId, address token) external nonReentrant whenNotPaused {\n        IDLPRegistry.DlpInfo memory dlp = refinerRegistry.dlpRegistry().dlps(dlpId);\n        if (dlp.ownerAddress != msg.sender) {\n            revert NotDlpOwner();\n        }\n        address dlpTreasuryAddress = dlp.treasuryAddress;\n        if (dlpTreasuryAddress == address(0)) {\n            revert InvalidDlpTreasuryAddress();\n        }\n\n        uint256 amount = _dlpPayments[dlpId][token];\n        _dlpPayments[dlpId][token] = 0;\n\n        emit DlpPaymentClaimed(dlpId, dlpTreasuryAddress, token, amount);\n\n        queryEngineTreasury.transfer(dlpTreasuryAddress, token, amount);\n    }\n\n    function balanceOf(uint256 dlpId, address token) external view returns (uint256) {\n        return _dlpPayments[dlpId][token];\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x68d51d065ff5a95920f8c718b50b58d7f73f3fb389c1c2d2b5064d6e763ce761","license":"MIT"},"contracts/queryEngine/interfaces/IQueryEngine.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity 0.8.24;\n\nimport \"../../dataAccessPayment/interfaces/IPaymentRequestor.sol\";\nimport {IDataRefinerRegistry} from \"../../dataRefinerRegistry/interfaces/IDataRefinerRegistry.sol\";\nimport {IComputeEngine} from \"../../computeEngine/interfaces/IComputeEngine.sol\";\nimport {IDataAccessTreasury} from \"../../dataAccessTreasury/interfaces/IDataAccessTreasury.sol\";\n\ninterface IQueryEngine is IPaymentRequestor {\n    /// @notice Permission struct for a single permission\n    /// @param grantee The address of the grantee\n    /// @param refinerId The id of the refiner/schema\n    /// @param tableName The name of the table\n    /// @param columnName The name of the column\n    /// @param approved Whether the permission has been approved\n    /// @param price The price of data access under the permission\n    struct Permission {\n        address grantee;\n        bool approved;\n        uint256 refinerId;\n        string tableName;\n        string columnName;\n        uint256 price;\n    }\n\n    struct PermissionInfo {\n        uint256 permissionId;\n        address grantee;\n        bool approved;\n        uint256 refinerId;\n        string tableName;\n        string columnName;\n        uint256 price;\n    }\n\n    /// @notice Pauses the contract\n    function pause() external;\n\n    /// @notice Unpauses the contract\n    function unpause() external;\n\n    /// @notice Returns the version of the contract\n    function version() external pure returns (uint256);\n\n    /// @notice Returns the refiner registry address\n    /// @return refinerRegistry The address of the refiner registry\n    function refinerRegistry() external view returns (IDataRefinerRegistry);\n\n    /// @notice Updates the refiner registry address\n    /// @param refinerRegistryAddress The address of the new refiner registry\n    function updateRefinerRegistry(address refinerRegistryAddress) external;\n\n    function computeEngine() external view returns (IComputeEngine);\n\n    function updateComputeEngine(address computeEngineAddress) external;\n\n    function dlpPaymentPercentage() external view returns (uint256);\n\n    function updateDlpPaymentPercentage(uint256 dlpPaymentPercentage) external;\n\n    function vanaTreasury() external view returns (address);\n\n    function updateVanaTreasury(address vanaTreasury) external;\n\n    function queryEngineTreasury() external view returns (IDataAccessTreasury);\n\n    function updateQueryEngineTreasury(IDataAccessTreasury queryEngineTreasury) external;\n\n    /// @notice Returns the permission for a given permission id\n    /// @param permissionId The id of the permission\n    /// @return permission The permission\n    function permissions(uint256 permissionId) external view returns (Permission memory);\n\n    /// @notice Returns the number of permissions in the contract\n    /// @return permissionCount The number of permissions\n    function permissionsCount() external view returns (uint256);\n\n    /// @notice Returns the permissions for a grantee against a refiner\n    /// @param refinerId The id of the refiner\n    /// @param grantee The address of the grantee\n    /// @return permissions The permissions\n    function getPermissions(uint256 refinerId, address grantee) external view returns (PermissionInfo[] memory);\n\n    /// @notice Adds a permission to the contract\n    /// @param grantee The address of the grantee\n    /// @param refinerId The id of the refiner\n    /// @param tableName The name of the table\n    /// @param columnName The name of the column\n    /// @param price The price of data access under the permission\n    /// @return permissionId The id of the permission\n    function addPermission(\n        address grantee,\n        uint256 refinerId,\n        string calldata tableName,\n        string calldata columnName,\n        uint256 price\n    ) external returns (uint256 permissionId);\n\n    /// @notice Adds a generic permission that is granted to everyone\n    /// @param refinerId The id of the refiner\n    /// @param tableName The name of the table\n    /// @param columnName The name of the column\n    /// @param price The price of data access under the permission\n    /// @return permissionId The id of the permission\n    function addGenericPermission(\n        uint256 refinerId,\n        string calldata tableName,\n        string calldata columnName,\n        uint256 price\n    ) external returns (uint256 permissionId);\n\n    /// @notice Updates the approval status of a permission\n    /// @param permissionId The id of the permission\n    /// @param approved The new approval status\n    function updatePermissionApproval(uint256 permissionId, bool approved) external;\n\n    function dlpPubKeys(uint256 dlpId) external view returns (string memory);\n    function updateDlpPubKey(uint256 dlpId, string calldata pubKey) external;\n}\n","keccak256":"0x7057478205dd92f7a1f3099cfd30c66e14bc919b948d67c8edd30d5d9f2c3b7b","license":"MIT"},"contracts/queryEngine/interfaces/QueryEngineStorageV1.sol":{"content":"// AccessControlBadConfirmation().details: The caller of a function is not the expected one. NOTE: Don't confuse with {AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount}.

AddressEmptyCode(address).details: There's no code at `target` (it is not a contract).

AddressInsufficientBalance(address).details: The ETH balance of the account is not enough to perform the operation.

ERC1967InvalidImplementation(address).details: The `implementation` of the proxy is invalid.

ERC1967NonPayable().details: An upgrade function sees `msg.value > 0` that may be lost.

EnforcedPause().details: The operation failed because the contract is paused.

ExpectedPause().details: The operation failed because the contract is not paused.

FailedInnerCall().details: A call to an address target failed. The target may have reverted.

SafeERC20FailedOperation(address).details: An operation with an ERC20 token failed.

UUPSUnauthorizedCallContext().details: The call is from an unauthorized context.

UUPSUnsupportedProxiableUUID(bytes32).details: The storage `slot` is unsupported as a UUID.

Initialized(uint64).details: Triggered when the contract has been initialized or reinitialized.

Paused(address).details: Emitted when the pause is triggered by `account`.

RoleAdminChanged(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32.details: Emitted when `newAdminRole` is set as ``role``'s admin role, replacing `previousAdminRole` `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` is the starting admin for all roles, despite {RoleAdminChanged} not being emitted signaling this.

RoleGranted(bytes32,address,address).details: Emitted when `account` is granted `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call, an admin role bearer except when using {AccessControl-_setupRole}.

RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address).details: Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)

Unpaused(address).details: Emitted when the pause is lifted by `account`.

Upgraded(address).details: Emitted when the implementation is upgraded.

params.price: The price of data access under the permission
The price of data access under the permission

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

addGenericPermission(uint256,string,stri.notice: Adds a generic permission that is granted to everyone

addPermission(address,uint256,string,str.notice: Adds a permission to the contract

dlpPaymentPercentage().notice: The percentage of the payment that goes to the DLP, in 1e18

getPermissions(uint256,address).notice: Returns the permissions for a grantee against a refiner

permissions(uint256).notice: Returns the permission for a given permission id

permissionsCount().notice: Returns the number of permissions in the contract

queryEngineTreasury().notice: The address of the treasury that holds the payment

updatePermissionApproval(uint256,bool).notice: Updates the approval status of a permission

vanaTreasury().notice: The address of the VANA treasury that receives (1 - dlpPaymentPercentage) of the payment

version().notice: Returns the version of the contract
